data.text: And Jacob called his sons, and said to them,
Assemble yourselves, that I may tell you
Reuben, thou art my firstborn,
Thou wast insolent like water, burst not forth with violence,
Simeon and Levi, brethren,
Let not my soul come into their counsel,
Cursed be their wrath, for it was willful,
Judah, thy brethren have praised thee,
Judah is a lion’s whelp:
A ruler shall not fail from Judah,
Binding his foal to the vine,
His eyes shall be more cheering than wine,
Zebulun shall dwell on the coast,
Issachar has desired that which is good;
And having seen the resting place that it was good,
Dan shall judge his people,
And let Dan be a serpent in the way,
Waiting for the salvation of the Lord.
Gad, a plundering troop shall plunder him;
Asher, his bread shall be fat;
Naphtali is a spreading stem,
Joseph is a son increased;
Against whom men taking evil counsel reproached him,
But their bow and arrows were mightily consumed,
And my God helped thee,
The blessings of thy father and thy mother—
Benjamin, as a ravening wolf,
All these are the twelve sons of Jacob; and their father spoke these words to them, and he blessed them; he blessed each of them according to his blessing.
And he said to them, I am added to my people; ye shall bury me with my fathers in the cave, which is in the field of Ephron the Hittite,
in the double cave which is opposite Mamre, in the land of Canaan, the cave which Abraham bought of Ephron the Hittite, for a possession of a sepulcher.
There they buried Abraham and Sarah his wife; there they buried Isaac, and Rebekah his wife; there they buried Leah;
in the portion of the field, and of the cave that was in it, purchased of the sons of Heth.
And Jacob ceased giving charges to his sons; and having lifted up his feet on the bed, he died, and was gathered to his people.
